more.Name: Report of Controlled Substances Examination
more.Summary: The Report of Controlled Substances Examination IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
more.Description: A Report of Controlled Substances Examination is sent from the Sheriff to the Prosecutor if the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substance related to a pending case.  The report details the lab results related to controlled substances.  The Prosecutor in turn informs the Public Defender of the lab results. .  The Report of Controlled Substances Examination contains lab information, description of the evidence, examination results, and a signature block.  The Report of Controlled Substances Examination is one of 44 IEPDs developed by the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California.  It could also be adapted for use in other states.
more.Status: IEPD CntrlSubLabRpt complete and ready for implementation
more.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
more.Process: If the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substances, the lab results are sent from the Sheriff to the Prosecutor and from the Prosecutor to the Public Defender.
more.TriggeringEvent: Report of Controlled Substances Examination Complete
more.Conditions: If the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substances.
more.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
more.Purpose: To inform the Prosecutor and Public Defender of lab results related to evidence in a pending case.
more.ExchangePartnerCategories: California state and local criminal justice agencies
